TopicTitle: What the hell, I don't even...

Articles.Content:
I was bored, had a large battleship, and wanted to test it's weapons on a ship near the mun, so I used infinite fuel.

And hacked gravity.
Good heavens, try changing your conics draw mode to 0 and see what that looks like.

This is what Ike does to your ships when he's mad.

Gotta love Ike.
I am not sure what you did there, but its cool!
looks fun and very kerbal to me

As near as i can tell, you injected into the mun soi, but at a very slow speed relative to the mun. The mun is then going to drag you all over creation as it orbits kerbin, giving the impression of that bizzare path.

You are only taking that crazy path with respect to kerbin. It will likely look like a curved line from the moon soi.

Edited December 16, 2013 by thiosk

I Think you broked gravity. Why would you broked gravity man?

I always love the quirky things this game throws at us sometimes
That looks like someone hacked gravity to me.

Actually, that's a known problem with that mode of patched conic drawing. We've seen it show up a few times before too. The actual orbit you get into around the body you're transitioning to is never even close to the crazy loop-de-loop it shows. I'm not sure we ever nailed down exactly what causes it, but I bet it's a rogue 0 somewhere in the calculations. That number does more damage to carefully-crafted programming logic than any other.

<snip>

I was bored, had a large battleship, and wanted to test it's weapons on a ship near the mun, so I used infinite fuel.

And hacked gravity.

I think you just answered your own question there

That looks like someone hacked gravity to me.

well... 2 body orbital mechanics being what they are....

http://www.universetoday.com/15019/how-many-moons-does-earth-have/

the fact that that is actualy a legitimate and aparently variable question.......

I was bored, had a large battleship, and wanted to test it's weapons on a ship near the mun, so I used infinite fuel.

And hacked gravity.

This is what happens when you Google Google, divide by zero & and learn what the ultimate question is.

Congratulations, you just won KSP.

Your prize is waiting at Eve's sea level.

As near as i can tell, you injected into the mun soi, but at a very slow speed relative to the mun. The mun is then going to drag you all over creation as it orbits kerbin, giving the impression of that bizzare path.

You are only taking that crazy path with respect to kerbin. It will likely look like a curved line from the moon soi.

This is probably what actually happen, since i have experience it first hand in the normal game
